results.title: Climb for the top
results.brief_description: Shows a team of mountain climbers preparing for and actually climbing Mt McKinley, the highest point in North America. Members discuss the elements of teamwork that are necessary to make it to the top. Narration by Sandy Fidell, Jeannie Rose, Don Lauria.
results.description: Shows a team of mountain climbers preparing for and actually climbing Mt McKinley, the highest point in North America. Members discuss the elements of teamwork that are necessary to make it to the top. Narration by Sandy Fidell, Jeannie Rose, Don Lauria.

results.title: Climb
results.creator_credit: Film Technology Company, Churchill Films and Dewitt Jones
results.brief_description: This is both a realistic adventure of rock-climbing and a metaphorical ascent in which limits are tested and personal values are explored. As the two climbers express their thoughts in the narration, we watch their breathtaking progress up a sheer rock face in Yosemite Valley. We learn a few rudiments of rock-climbing and about the climbers feelings and motivations.

results.title: Climats = Climates of Love
results.brief_description:
Philippe and Odile divorce after a stormy marriage. But Philippe’s new relationship with Isabelle proves equally disastrous. Having gone from whimsical Odile to calm and composed Isabelle, Philippe is hopelessely bored and starts looking for a diversion with Misa. Just when happiness and desire seem to come his way, Isabelle and Odile send cries for help.

Credits: Producer, Robert Vignon ; director, Stellio Lorenzi ;
writers, Stellio Lorenzi, Rene Cortade, Rodolphe-Maurice Arlaud, Alain
Decaux.
Cast: Marina Vlady, Jean-Pierre Marielle, Michel Piccoli, Emmanuelle Riva, Alexandra Stewart.

results.title: Climate and the world we live in
results.brief_description: The film shows the factors which determine latitude, altitude, nearness to water, ocean currents, prevailing winds, and mountains.

results.title: Cliff hanging moments from the serials
results.brief_description: A selection of three trailers from the 1920s motion picture serials and feature films: 1. The 15 chapter serial “The Steel Trail” (1923), starring William Duncan and Edith Johnson. 2. The 15 chapter serial “Captain Kidd” (1922) starring Eddie Polo. 3. “A Woman in grey” (1920) starring Arline Pretty and Henry G. Sell

results.title: Cliff hangers [B&W]
results.brief_description: Over a gleaming ice field and up steep cliffs of bare rock, the camera follows members of the Alpine Club of Canada. Before they set out we are introduced to the climbers’ basic equipment and learn the uses of rope and ice axe. Excitement mounts with the Alpinists as they leap gaping chasms and drag themselves up a sheer wall of rock. At the top, they pause for a view of the sea of mountains lying around their own vanquished peak. Narrated by Lorne Greene.

results.title: Clickers club: photo adventures in curriculum
results.creator_credit: Corporate Development, Western Region and TV ED Productions, Tony Paice and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Outlines the aims of a new photography club established throughout Victorian schools. Marg Sheehan interviews Leigh Hepburn who introduces the Project Kit, Roxanne Rodgers who explains its uses in an integrated curriculum and Gail Evans who applies the resources during a primary school class excursion to the zoo.

results.title: Click go the shears
results.creator_credit: Link Films, Keith Gow and Jerome Levy
results.brief_description: A highly stylised humorous treatment of the famous Australian ballad, using a minimum of animation. Sung by Cedric McLaughlin and the Link Singers.

results.title: Clever Hiko Ichi
results.brief_description: Provides a backdrop for language arts activities such as storytelling, creative dramatics, and reading, by presenting an animated story about a little boy in medieval Japan who solves three difficult problems with a bit of applied science and personal fortitude.
